info.title: Mitigation Methods API
info.description:
# Overview
The Alert Mitigation Methods API provides programmatic access to Kentik's capabilities of configuring and managing mitigation methods that define the specific parameters used for network infrastructure mitigations.

get.description: Returns a list of mitigation methods.

parameters.name: pagination.limit
parameters.description: limit is how many items to return at most.

parameters.name: pagination.offset
parameters.description: offset is the offset into the list of items.

parameters.name: pagination.includeTotalCount
parameters.description:
include_total_count is a flag to enforce API service to include the total count of items in the response,
which in some cases may be very expensive to fetch.

parameters.name: filters.methodIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the mitigation methods to list.

parameters.name: filters.platformTypes
parameters.description:
The platform types the mitigation methods are associated with.

 - MITIGATION_PLATFORM_TYPE_A10: A10 mitigation platform
 - MITIGATION_PLATFORM_TYPE_FLOWSPEC: FlowSpec mitigation platform
 - MITIGATION_PLATFORM_TYPE_RADWARE: Radware mitigation platform
 - MITIGATION_PLATFORM_TYPE_RTBH: RTBH mitigation platform
 - MITIGATION_PLATFORM_TYPE_CFMT: CFMT mitigation platform
 - MITIGATION_PLATFORM_TYPE_ADAPTIVE_FLOWSPEC: Adaptive FlowSpec mitigation platform

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the mitigation method to get.

limit.title: limit is how many items to return at most

offset.title: offset is the offset into the list of items

includeTotalCount.title:
include_total_count is a flag to enforce API service to include the total count of items in the response,
which in some cases may be very expensive to fetch

totalCount.description:
total_count is the total number of items in the list.
It may be provided optionally if include_total_count is set to false.
It will be provided always if include_total_count is set to true.

hasMoreResults.title:
has_more_results is a flag to indicate if there are more results to fetch
It may be provided instead of total_count if include_total_count is set to false and it would be very expensive to fetch the total count

id.description: The ID of the mitigation method.

name.description: The name of the mitigation method.

description.description: The description of the mitigation method.

ackRequired.description: Whether acknowledgment is required before applying this mitigation method.

excludedIpCidrs.description: The IP/CIDR ranges that are excluded from this mitigation method.

gracePeriod.description: The grace period before the mitigation method is applied.

type.description: The platform type this mitigation method is designed for.

createdAt.description: The time when the mitigation method was created.

modifiedAt.description: The time when the mitigation method was last modified.

notifications.description: The notification channel associations for this mitigation method.

methodIds.description: The IDs of the mitigation methods to list.

platformTypes.description: The platform types the mitigation methods are associated with.

createdAt.description: The time range for the created time of the mitigation methods.

modifiedAt.description: The time range for the modified time of the mitigation methods.

method.description: The mitigation method that was retrieved.

pagination.description: The pagination information for the list response.

methods.description: The mitigation methods that were found matching the filters.
